summary: liverpool manager brendan rodgers has reminded raheem sterling and jordon ibe about their professional responsibilities . sterling , the england international who will lead liverpool 's line at wembley on sunday in the absence of the injured daniel sturridge , was exposed for inhaling the legal high nitrous oxide on monday . ibe was present among the reds squad during their training session on friday ahead of their fa cup semi .

aspect: 1. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities.
2. Rodgers urged them to learn from a chastening week that involved Sterling inhaling nitrous oxide and pictures of them with shisha pipes.
3. Rodgers spoke to Sterling and Ibe in his office on Thursday; neither will be disciplined.
4. Rodgers wants to draw a line under the matter and focus on steering Liverpool into their first FA Cup final.
5. Rodgers made it clear that his priority is giving Gerrard an immediate recall against Villa.
6. Rodgers thinks Liverpool are ready to progress, having learned from their close losses in the title race and cup last season.
explain: Professional responsibilities refer to the obligations and duties that someone has to perform in their job or career. It includes meeting deadlines, maintaining a certain level of performance, and conducting oneself in a manner that is appropriate to their profession. In this context, Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their responsibilities as professional football players. This likely includes playing to the best of their abilities, maintaining a clean image off the field, and acting in a way that represents the club positively.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers stressed the importance of professional responsibility for players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe following their involvement in incidents that caused controversy this week. Sterling, who will captain Liverpool in the FA Cup semi-final against Everton on Sunday, was exposed for using the legal high nitrous oxide on Monday, while Ibe was present during their training session on Friday ahead of the Cup clash. Rodgers reminded both players of their responsibilities as professional footballers and urged them to learn from the controversial events of the past week.
Brendan Rodgers met with Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe individually in his office on Thursday to remind them about their professional responsibilities.
Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers wants to focus on steering the team into their first FA Cup final, and is not interested in discussions about players' personal lives.

Brendan Rodgers has made it clear that his top priority is to give Steven Gerrard an immediate recall against Aston Villa. This means that Rodgers wants to bring Gerrard back into the team as soon as possible and is willing to sacrifice other players' performances for the sake of Gerrard. This shows the high level of trust and respect that Rodgers has for Gerrard and his experience in big matches. It also emphasizes the importance of Gerrard to the team and their chances of winning the match.

Rodgers believes that his team has the potential to advance due to the lessons learned from their previous championship and cup campaigns, where they experienced close losses last year. They have gained experience and can apply it in their upcoming matches.
